text: Seagate Software was an international software company formed when Seagate Technology, merged its software assets with Arcada Software. Kevin Azzouz, Arcada CEO was elected by the Seagate board as president. Seagate Software was sold to Veritas Software in 1999 in a deal worth $1.6 billion.Veritas Software to Acquire Seagate Unit in Stock Swap, By LAWRENCE M. FISHER, Published: October 6, 1998, NYTimes.com On March 29, 2000, Seagate announced the sale of all its remaining Veritas Software shares to Veritas Software. The finalisation of the deal was announced on November 22, 2000. ==See also== * NTBackup ==References== Category:Defunct software companies Category:Software companies based in California Category:Software companies of the United States
